benchmark_details.name: Panel of LLm Evaluators (PoLL)
benchmark_details.overview: The benchmark proposes to evaluate LLM generations using a Panel of LLM evaluators (PoLL) instead of relying on single large judges, demonstrating better correlation with human judgements and cost-effectiveness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a more effective method for evaluating LLM performance while reducing costs and biases associated with single large model evaluations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The current work only addresses three evaluator settings and a limited number of judges, indicating the need for broader applicability investigations.

data.source: Evaluations conducted using diverse datasets including KILT.
data.annotation: Human annotations were performed, comprising diverse professional backgrounds.

methodology.calculation: Cohen’s kappa measures inter-rater reliability across different evaluators.
methodology.interpretation: A Cohen’s kappa value over 0.6 indicates a moderate correlation, and over 0.8 indicates strong agreement.
methodology.baseline_results: PoLL achieved the highest correlation scores with human judgments across various tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation processes were based on correlation with human judgments and other established datasets.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Annotations included diverse backgrounds to minimize bias.
targeted_risks.harm: Reducing intra-model bias in evaluations to improve fairness.
